themes.label: Decrees
themes.rationale: The text contains the standard formula for a decree, mentioning that it 'seemed good to the people' (edoxe toi damoi) and the senate (synkletos).
themes.quote: δοξε τ ι δ μωι ποιε σθαι τ μ ... τ ι δ συγκλ τωι δοξεν

themes.label: Oracular and Prophetic Texts
themes.rationale: The inscription explicitly mentions oracles (chresmoi) given by the goddess Ma.
themes.quote: χρησμο ς ... ο τος χρησμ ς δ π λις συρακοσ ων

themes.label: Sacred Laws and Rules
themes.rationale: The text regulates religious activities, including the sending of sacred envoys (thearoi) and the performance of sacrifices to the goddess Ma.
themes.quote: παγγ λλοντας τ ν θυσ αν τ ι θε ι μα ηι

themes.label: Accounts and Financial Records
themes.rationale: The decree specifies a financial allocation of 200 drachmas to be given to each sacred envoy (thearos).
themes.quote: διακοσ [ας δραχμ ς δ μεν κ στωι θεαρ ι]

themes.label: Lists of Officials or Citizens
themes.rationale: The text mentions the appointment or recording of sacred envoys (thearoi) and hosts for these envoys (thearodokoi).
themes.quote: ποιε σθαι τ ν θεαροδ κων ... θεαρο ς

themes.label: Stele
themes.rationale: The inscription explicitly refers to itself being recorded on a stone stele.
themes.quote: τ σδε τ ς ερ [ς στ λας]

rationale: This complex inscription from Akrai records a decree concerning the goddess Ma. It details the reception of oracles, the sending of sacred envoys (thearoi) to Pamphylia, and the financial and administrative arrangements for these religious missions. The text mentions the city of Syracuse and the senate (synkletos), indicating the political and religious interconnectedness of the region. The decree was to be set up in the temple of Apollo on a stone stele.
